results.title: Scouting in Australia
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Joe Scully, Australian Boy Scouts Association and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Illustrates the impact upon a boy of his joining the Scouts, the involvement of his father in the Movement, the Scouts’ work in the community and the international status of the Scouting Movement. Includes scenes of a Scout Rally, an investiture, a Group Committee and the ‘Jamboree of the New Endeavour’ at Leppington, N.S.W

results.title: Autumn of a mining town
results.creator_credit: Phillip Mark-Law, Joe Scully and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Perhaps due to its fascinating past and equally astonishing present, the Victorian gold rush town of Ballarat catches the quintessence of Victorian Australia - the curious old homes; the old tramcars; the coffee palace; the Cobb & Co office; the gardens and the people. No narration. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Anokhi
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian neighbours: India”.
The story of John and Faith Singh and their work in maintaining the traditional hand printed clothing “industry” of the villages around Jaipur.

results.title: Forward communications
results.creator_credit: Bern Gandy and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Stresses that Australia’s vast distances make an efficient system of communication most essential. Shows how the Post Office is maintaining our present communications system at a high level of efficiency and also how the heavy post-war demand for new telephones and exchanges is being met.

results.title: Overtaking and being overtaken
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Suggests ways in which the defensive driver can overtake and how to react to being overtaken. Shows the pitfalls leading to accidents while overtaking and being overtaken. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Pearlers
results.creator_credit: Lee Robinson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: An insight into the work of the pearling industry on the northern coast of Australia. Shows the preparation of the diver before going below; the hazardous work as he gathers pearl shell from the sea floor; opening the shells, searching for pearls and packing the shell on board the lugger; return of the lugger to port and packing of the shell for export.

results.title: Australian weekend
results.creator_credit: Rhonda Small and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Indicates some of the ways in which Australians find recreation in their weekends. The people of Sydney go surfing, yachting, hiking, fishing, or playing cricket, bowls or golf during the day, and dance on the foreshores of the harbour at night. Music but no commentary.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 097
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: a versatile woman runs a farm by herself; blindness poses no impediment to a group of children’s happiness and ship provisioning is a skilled and intricate job.

results.title: The Mystery single vehicle crash
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Although many drivers involved in single vehicle crashes attribute the cause of their accidents to mechanical failures of the car, very often it was the driver and not the car who was to blame. This film stresses that while mechanical checks of one’s car most important, it is even more vital that the driver is in good physical and mental condition before taking to the road.
